1.abstract: Authored a full-length paper for the WEB3 Conference, 2022 - Research track.
1.title: Under Review

2.abstract: Co-authored a workshop paper for the CVPR 2022 AI City Challenge Workshop - Track 4, where a built a pipeline to identify multi-class retail products from real-time videos for automatic retail checkout through a combination of segmentation, classification and custom heuristics to have a model with over 45% F-score and globally secured the 3rd place.
2.title: VISTA: Vision Transformer enhanced by U-Net and Image Colorfulness Frame Filtration for Automatic Retail Checkout
2.authors: Istiak Hossain Shihab, Nazia Tasnim, Hasib Zunair, Labiba Kanij Rupty, Nabeel Mohammed

3.abstract: Authored a workshop paper for the NAACL 2022 SemEval Workshop - Task 11, where we demonstrate our approach in tackling the challenge of recognizing complex open-domain Named Entities in Bangla, through data augmentation and majority-voting based ensembling efforts. The mode performed competitively in the task and placed 8th in the overall global ranking.
3.title: On leveraging data augmentation and ensemble to recognize complex Named Entities in Bangla
3.authors: Nazia Tasnim, Md. Istiak Shihab, Asif Shahriyar Sushmit, Steven Bethard, Farig Sadeque

4.abstract: Authored a workshop paper accepted for spotlight presentation in the Joint KDD 2021 Health Day and 2021 KDD Workshop on Applied Data Science for Healthcare workshop titled 'Exploring the Scope and Potential of Local Newspaper-based Dengue Surveillance in Bangladesh'. Main contribution includes technique of developing a novel database, using human-in-the-loop techniques in conjunction with guided data mining techniques and methods of classification of dengue disease and its intervention-related news.
4.title: Exploring the Scope and Potential of Local Newspaper-based Dengue Surveillance in Bangladesh
4.publisher: KDD Workshop on Applied Data Science for Healthcare
4.authors: Nazia Tasnim, Md. Istiak Hossain Shihab, Moqsadur Rahman, Sheikh Rabiul Islam, Mohammad Ruhul Amin

5.abstract: Authored one conference paper in The 34th International FLAIRS Conference, titled : 'Observing the Unobserved: A Newspaper Based Dengue Surveillance System for the Low-Income Regions of Bangladesh'.The task required unstructured newspaper data scraping, pre-processing, topic modeling with Guided LDA, classifying with SVM and developing insights from data visualizations. The goal is to aid the relevant authorities in identifying the gaps present in current dengue intervention programs and establishing policies.
5.title: Observing the Unobserved: A Newspaper Based Dengue Surveillance System for the Low-Income Regions of Bangladesh
5.publisher: The FLORIDA ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE RESEARCH SOCIETY
5.authors: Nazia Tasnim, Istiak Hossain Shihab, Moqsadur Rahman, Jillur Rahman Saurav, Sheikh Rabiul Islam, Mohammad Ruhul Amin

6.abstract: Co-authored a journal paper ’Choice of assemblers has a critical impact on denovo assembly of SARS-CoV-2 genome and characterizing variants’,published on Briefings in Bioinformatics. My tasks included analysis of the genomic variant call patterns and visualizing the trends.
6.title: Choice of assemblers has a critical impact on denovo assembly of SARS-CoV-2 genome and characterizing variants
6.authors: Rashedul Islam, Rajan Saha Raju, Nazia Tasnim, Istiak Hossain Shihab, Maruf Ahmed Bhuiyan, Yusha Araf, Tofazzal Islam
